info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Northampton, Greensville, Southampton, Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie, south central Surry and southeastern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 545 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carson to 6 miles south of Littleton. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Emporia, Waverly, Courtland, Garysburg, Rich Square, Wakefield, Boykins, Dahlia, Purdy, Sussex, Gaston, Conway, Woodland, Jarratt, Seaboard, Newsoms, Dendron, Stony Creek and Green Plain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
